dinosaurs.name: Velociraptor
dinosaurs.description: Velociraptor is a genus of dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaur that lived approximately 75 to 71 million years ago during the latter part of the Cretaceous Period.
dinosaurs.discovery: Discovered in 1924 by Henry Fairfield Osborn
funFacts: Had feathers, not scales like in movies
Was actually about the size of a turkey
Hunted in packs
Had a sickle-shaped claw on each foot

dinosaurs.name: Triceratops
dinosaurs.description: Triceratops is a genus of herbivorous ceratopsid dinosaur that first appeared during the late Maastrichtian stage of the late Cretaceous period, about 68 million years ago in what is now North America.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1887 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Had the largest skull of any land animal
Could defend against T-Rex attacks
Lived in herds
Had a beak-like mouth for eating plants

dinosaurs.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
dinosaurs.description: Tyrannosaurus is a genus of large theropod dinosaur. The species Tyrannosaurus rex, often called T. rex or colloquially T-Rex, is one of the best represented of these large theropods.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1902 by Barnum Brown
funFacts: Had the strongest bite force of any land animal
Could crush bone with its teeth
Had tiny arms but powerful legs
May have been a scavenger as well as a hunter

dinosaurs.name: Stegosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Stegosaurus is a genus of herbivorous, four-legged, armored dinosaur from the Late Jurassic, characterized by the distinctive kite-shaped upright plates along their backs and spikes on their tails.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1877 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Had a brain the size of a walnut
Plates may have been used for temperature regulation
Had spikes on its tail for defense
Could grow up to 30 feet long

dinosaurs.name: Brachiosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Brachiosaurus is a genus of sauropod dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Jurassic, about 154â€“153 million years ago. It was one of the tallest and largest dinosaurs.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1903 by Elmer S. Riggs
funFacts: One of the tallest dinosaurs ever
Had nostrils on top of its head
Could reach vegetation 50 feet high
Had a long neck to reach tree tops

dinosaurs.name: Spinosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Spinosaurus is a genus of spinosaurid dinosaur that lived in what now is North Africa during the Cenomanian to upper Turonian stages of the Late Cretaceous period, about 99 to 93.5 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1912 by Ernst Stromer
funFacts: Largest carnivorous dinosaur
Semi-aquatic lifestyle
Had a sail-like structure on its back
Specialized in catching fish
